meanings.definition: Wackes (noun): a type of sedimentary rock consisting of a mixture of various minerals and rock fragments
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the wackes to learn about the different minerals present.
meanings.sent2: The hiker found a piece of wackes along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The wackes in the riverbed looked like a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent4: The wackes in the quarry were like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The wackes shimmered in the sunlight, revealing its hidden beauty.

meanings.definition: Wackes (verb): to strike or hit with a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: He wackes the nail with a hammer to secure it in place.
meanings.sent2: The boxer wackes his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She wackes the drum in rhythm with the music.
meanings.sent4: The storm wackes the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith wackes the hot metal to shape it into a sword.

meanings.definition: Wackes (adjective): of poor quality or inferior; not up to standard
meanings.sent1: The wackes shoes fell apart after just a few days of wear.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served wackes food that left a bad taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: His wackes attempt at painting resulted in a messy canvas.
meanings.sent4: The wackes performance of the band disappointed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wackes product failed to meet the customers' expectations.
